info.description: Complete API collection for HRMS Backend (Single Database)

request.description:
Step 2: Register organization. Stores data in temp table and sends OTP to email.

**Fields:**
- email: Admin email (must be unique)
- companyName: Company name (must be unique)
- fullName: Admin full name
- password: Password (min 8 chars, must contain uppercase, lowercase, number)
- confirmPassword: Must match password
- longitude: Office longitude
- latitude: Office latitude
- radius: Office radius in meters
- officeAddress: Office address
- agreementAccepted: Boolean (required) - Registration agreement acceptance

**Response:** Returns message and email. Check email for OTP.

Step 3: Verify OTP. Moves data from temp table to actual tables (Organization + Admin User).

**Fields:**
- email: Email used during registration
- otp: 6-digit OTP received via email (expires in 15 minutes)

**After verification:** User needs to login separately.

Get company profile details. Admin only.

**Returns:**
- Company name, address, location (lat/lng/radius)
- Work hours (start/end time)
- Weekly off days (0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday)
- Agreement acceptance record
- Active status

Update company profile. Admin only.

**Fields (all optional):**
- workStartTime: String (HH:mm format, 24-hour) - Default: 09:00
- workEndTime: String (HH:mm format, 24-hour) - Default: 18:00
- weeklyOffDays: Array of numbers (0-6) - 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, ..., 6=Saturday
- officeAddress: String
- latitude: Number
- longitude: Number
- radius: Number (in meters)

**Note:** Only provided fields will be updated.
Login with email and password. Returns JWT token with user info including organizationId.

Set password for employees created by admin. Token is received via email when admin creates a new user.

**Fields:**
- token: Token from password setup email (required) - uniquely identifies the user
- password: New password (min 8 chars, must contain uppercase, lowercase, number)

**Note:** Token expires in 24 hours. After setting password, user can login normally. Email is not needed as the token uniquely identifies the user.

Create a new user. Admin only. Password setup email will be sent.

**Important:**
- Email must be unique across all organizations
- Role can only be 'employee' (admin role is not allowed - only one admin per organization)
- If role is not provided, defaults to 'employee'
- Employee ID is auto-generated (EMP001, EMP002, etc.)
- Admin user created during registration gets EMP001
- **remote:** Boolean (required) - If true, location validation is skipped for check-in/check-out (can check in from anywhere). If false, must be within office radius.

formdata.description: Excel file with columns: First Name, Last Name, Email, Mobile Number, Role (must be 'employee'), Status. All emails must be unique.

request.description:
Bulk upload users from Excel file. Admin only.

**Excel Format:**
- Columns: First Name, Last Name, Email, Mobile Number, Role, Status, Remote
- All emails must be unique across all organizations
- Role can only be 'employee' (admin role will be rejected)
- **Remote:** Boolean column (true/false, 1/0, or yes/no) - If true, location validation is skipped for check-in/check-out. Defaults to false if not provided.
- Invalid rows will be skipped with error messages showing row numbers
Get all users. Admin sees all users in their organization, employee sees only their own profile.
Get user by ID. Employees can only view their own profile.

Update user information. Admin only.

**Important:**
- Admin user CANNOT be updated (protected)
- Email must be unique if being updated
- Role cannot be updated (immutable)
- **remote:** Boolean (optional) - If true, location validation is skipped for check-in/check-out. If false, must be within office radius.
- All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated

Delete a user. Admin only.

**Important:**
- Admin user CANNOT be deleted (protected)
- Active employees CANNOT be deleted - must deactivate first
- Only inactive employee users can be deleted

Check in with location. Uses form-data (multipart/form-data).

**Form Data Fields:**
- latitude: Number (required) - User's latitude
- longitude: Number (required) - User's longitude
- address: String (optional) - Address text
- selfie: File (optional) - Selfie image (JPEG/PNG, max 5MB)

**Location Validation:**
- If user.remote = false: Location must be within office radius (distance validation applies)
- If user.remote = true: Location validation is skipped (can check in from anywhere)

**Shift Validation:**
- Checks user's assigned shift (or default shift if none assigned)
- Blocks check-in if today is an off day (days array has 0 for current day)
- Calculates attendanceStatus based on check-in time:
  - "before-time": check-in time < start time
  - "on-time": start time ≤ check-in time ≤ late time
  - "late": check-in time > late time

**Returns:**
- attendanceStatus: "on-time" | "before-time" | "late"

**Note:** Form data sends strings, but latitude/longitude are automatically converted to numbers.

Check out with location. Uses form-data (multipart/form-data). Must have checked in first.

**Form Data Fields:**
- latitude: Number (required) - User's latitude
- longitude: Number (required) - User's longitude
- address: String (optional) - Address text
- selfie: File (optional) - Selfie image (JPEG/PNG, max 5MB)

**Location Validation:**
- If user.remote = false: Location must be within office radius (distance validation applies)
- If user.remote = true: Location validation is skipped (can check out from anywhere)

**Note:** Form data sends strings, but latitude/longitude are automatically converted to numbers.

request.description:
Export attendance records as CSV. Admin can filter by userId, employees see only own records.

**Returns:**
- CSV content with headers: Date, Employee Name, Email, Check-In Time, Check-Out Time, Total Hours, Status, Check-In Location, Check-Out Location
- Filename for download

**Note:** Use the CSV content to create a downloadable file.

Get check-in locations for map visualization. Returns all check-in locations with coordinates and user info.

**Returns:**
- Array of check-in locations with:
  - userId (with firstName, lastName, email, employeeId)
  - checkInTime
  - location (latitude, longitude, address)
  - status

**Use Case:** Display check-in pin points on a map in the dashboard.

Create a new shift for the organization. Admin only.

**Fields:**
- name: String (required) - Shift name (unique per organization)
- startTime: String (required) - Start time in HH:mm format (24-hour, e.g., "08:00")
- endTime: String (required) - End time in HH:mm format (24-hour, e.g., "16:00")
- lateTime: String (required) - Late time in HH:mm format (24-hour, e.g., "08:30"). Must be between startTime and endTime
- days: Array (required) - Array of 7 numbers [Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday]
  - 0 = off day, 1 = working day
  - Example: [0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0] = Monday to Friday working

**Limits:**
- Maximum 10 shifts per organization
- Shift name must be unique per organization

**Note:** Default shift is global and cannot be created, updated, or deleted. It's automatically available to all users without a custom shift assignment.

Get all shifts for the organization (including default shift).

**Returns:**
- Array of shifts with:
  - id: Shift ID ("default" for default shift)
  - name: Shift name
  - startTime: Start time (HH:mm)
  - endTime: End time (HH:mm)
  - lateTime: Late time (HH:mm)
  - days: Array of 7 numbers [Sunday to Saturday]
  - organizationId: Organization ID (included for default shift too)
  - isDefault: Boolean (true for default shift)
  - createdAt, updatedAt: Timestamps (null for default shift)

**Note:** Default shift is always included at the beginning of the array.

variable.description: Shift ID or 'default' for default shift

request.description:
Get shift by ID. Use 'default' to get the default shift.

**Returns:**
- Shift object with all details
- Default shift can be retrieved using id: 'default'

Update shift. Admin only.

**Fields:**
- All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated
- name: String (optional)
- startTime: String (optional) - HH:mm format
- endTime: String (optional) - HH:mm format
- lateTime: String (optional) - HH:mm format (must be between startTime and endTime)
- days: Array (optional) - Array of 7 numbers [Sunday to Saturday]

**Note:** Default shift cannot be updated. Only organization-specific shifts can be updated.

Delete shift. Admin only.

**Validation:**
- Cannot delete if any users are assigned to this shift
- Default shift cannot be deleted

**Error:** If users are assigned, returns error with count of assigned users. Reassign users first.

Assign a shift to a user. Admin only.

**Fields:**
- userId: String (required) - User ID to assign shift to
- shiftId: String (required) - Shift ID to assign (cannot be 'default')

**Validation:**
- User must belong to the organization
- Shift must belong to the organization
- Default shift cannot be assigned explicitly (remove shift assignment to use default)

**Note:** If user has no shift assigned, default shift is automatically used.

variable.description: User ID to remove shift assignment from

request.description:
Remove shift assignment from user. User will use default shift. Admin only.

**Note:** After removal, user will automatically use the default shift for attendance calculations.

Get dashboard statistics. Admin only.

**Returns:**
- **users:** Total, admins, employees count
- **attendance:** Today (checkedIn, checkedOut, pending), week, month, averageHours
- **recentAttendance:** Last 10 attendance records
- **recentEmployeeActions:** Last 20 employee actions (check-ins/check-outs) with action type and time
- **mapLocations:** Today's check-in locations for map visualization (latitude, longitude, address, user info)

**Use Cases:**
- Display statistics cards
- Show recent attendance table
- Show recent employee actions table
- Display map with check-in pin points
